job_title: Patient Care Technician in Greenwood, SC
pros: It was a pretty solid place to work. Felt supported by most of the staff, and were flexible with hours I wanted to work.
cons: Some of the nurses had been doing it too long and took that out by being rude and yelling in front of patients, which was not cool, and management did nothing (and continued doing nothing; when I went into nursing school afterwards and did clinicals on the same floor, the same nurses were still there doing the same awful stuff). Pay is kinda low for the job, and staffing is painful, but that's most healthcare places these days I think.

review_title: President of Self needs to go.
pros: You get to meet people and learn to be more caring toward them. Also you really get attached to the cancer patients and get to listen to their fears . You can help the patient and family to have some hope with their treatments. Also the people who work there are like a big family. My job helped me to be a more loving and caring person.
cons: Unfair when it comes to layoffs. they do not go by your years you have worked. I was a hard worker and years, but the younger and healthier workers were kept.

review_title: It's all about who you know, who likes you and who can snap their fingers to fire you.
job_title: Data Center Analyst in Greenwood, SC
pros: The IT department is fairly lax on schedules allowing breaks as needed ( Though generally expected to only take a break if you absolutely have to, no scheduled breaks)
cons: They hire from within. This would normally be great but because of these those who are buddy buddy, have a significant other, or simply are friends unqualified employees will get positions which they don't deserve.

pros: It is a job and hopefully they wont fire you.
cons: Administration is concerned with only money and pleasing the doctors in hopes they will send more patients as referrals. Employees are treated as simple interferes to the bottom line. There are many great nurses and staff. But many great nurses and staff are being individually targeted and terminated for fabricated policy violations. Avoid this employer.

pros: My co workers are wonderful people who really care about their patients and always try to do their best to go above and beyond when they can!
cons: Understaffed and over worked. Lots of turnover on the nursing units and lots of people getting burned out. Management expects more than what is physically possible of the limited staff on the floor. Nurses can expect to have 8 patients on a regular basis.
